channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0903; 02:40PM; 20750 W Marilla St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4ceULFb" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4ceULFb</a>; #Chatsworth; LAFD's Hazardous Materials specialists continue to investigate the identity and source of the vapor cloud coming from an outdoor storage area behind a large one-story commercial building. The 31 occupants of the building have been safely evacuated. Paramedics evaluated eight people. Seven declined hospital transport. One person (approximately 50-year-old male) was transported with only minor medical complaints. PIO Captain Adam Van Gerpen is on scene for media requests. Media please stage south of the incident at Superior Street and Lurline Avenue. ; FS 107; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AP43 BC10 BC15 BC17 CE83 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E107 E275 E28 E287 E295 E296 E472 E75 E87 E93 EA2 EM12 EM15 EM17 ER1 ER3 HD75 JT1 JT2 PI2 RA104 RA105 RA106 RA107 RA72 RA87 RA95 RA96 SQ87 SQ95 T75 T87 T95 T96; CH8; 14 17 18; Nicholas Prange

Hazardous Materials; INC#0903; 01:03PM; 20750 W Marilla St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4ceULFb" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4ceULFb</a>; #Chatsworth; Firefighters are on scene of a hazardous materials investigation at a large (approximately 200' x 300') one-story commercial building with an unknown vapor coming from behind the building. Firefighters are helping the (approximately 70) occupants of the building to evacuate. They will isolate the hazard area and deny entry until the nature of the vapor cloud is known. No reported patients. There is no known offsite hazard. LAPD Inc #2742.; FS 107; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AP43 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E107 E275 E28 E287 E295 E296 E472 E75 E87 EM12 EM15 EM17 ER1 ER3 HD75 JT1 JT2 RA104 RA106 RA107 RA95 RA96 SQ87 SQ95 T75 T87 T95 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Civilian Fatality Structure Fire - Now Out 06/10/2024 INC#0641

item.description: Civilian Fatality Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0641; 10:35AM; 2519 W 74th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3yNLvt9" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3yNLvt9</a>; #HydePark; PRELIM: 43 Firefighters took just 14 minutes (10:49 AM) to access, confine and fully extinguish flames within a 2,200 square foot one-story home. Despite the lack of any smoke alarms within the 101 year-old residence, an elder female became aware of the fire, and was able to escape from the rear of the home without injury. Sadly, her elder male bedridden spouse was discovered lifeless in the front of the residence. Beyond medical assistance, He was determined deceased and remains at the scene. No other injuries were reported. Fire cause under investigation. Mayor's Crisis Response Team volunteers are en route to assist the woman, family and neighbors. Media Inquiries: Medical Examiner (No Case # Available).; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR12 AR21 AR35 BC13 CM20 CM22 E233 E266 E57 E66 PH1 RA266 RA57 RA857 T33 T66; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey
item.category: Civilian Fatality Structure Fire - Now Out

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 06/10/2024 INC#0004

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0004; 12:30AM; 520 W 118th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3KGj8Qc" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3KGj8Qc</a>; #VermontVista; *Address Corrected*. In a well-coordinated offensive firefight, 52 LAFD Firefighters took just 29 minutes to extinguish heavy fire on the first floor of a 2,478 square foot combination one- and two-story home. As the intense flames were extinguished, firefighters discovered an adult female within the home in need of immediate medical care. She was transported by ambulance in undetermined condition to an area hospital. No other injuries were reported. The fire's cause is under active investigation. No additional details are currently available. ; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC11 BC13 E233 E264 E266 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 RA264 RA46 RA64 RA65 RA864 T33 T64 T66; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0004; 12:01AM; 460 W 118th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3VApVBm" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3VApVBm</a>; #VermontVista; PRELIM: Fire showing from the first floor of a two-story home.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC11 BC13 E233 E264 E266 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 RA264 RA65 RA864 T33 T64 T66; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1754; 11:09PM; 15460 W Roxford St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3x1gKRc" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3x1gKRc</a>; #Sylmar; 42 LAFD Firefighters took just 17 minutes to extinguish heavy fire, confining flames within the unoccupied one-story detached 2-car garage at the rear of the residential property, that had been converted to living quarters. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E18 E275 E287 E298 E75 E91 E98 RA891 RA91 T75 T87 T98; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Train vs. Pedestrian Fatality; INC#1644; 09:29PM; Railroad Tracks East of 7600 Woodman Ave; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/awGYME9wbQmtbEmS7" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/awGYME9wbQmtbEmS7</a>; #VanNuys; PRELIM: Two adult pedestrians (one male, one female, approximately 35 years of age) deceased at scene after being struck by southbound Amtrak Pacific Surfliner Train #794. The train remains at scene. No other injuries reported. None of the 119 passengers or crew aboard the intercity passenger train require medical assistance. Media Inquiries: Amtrak, LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #4115) and Medical Examiner.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC14 E289 E39 E89 E98 EM14 HR3 RA39 RA89 T89 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 BC5 E229 E260 E60 E76 E86 RA76 RA86 T29 T60; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey
